content:
Have you contacted your mail service provider about their retention policy on deleted mail. My guess is it is 30 days.

Folk appear to miss the whole IMAP syncronised means you get to keep what your provider decides you get to keep without the bounds of their retention policies.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks for your reply. I imagine that that is the problem. In the past, I was able to check a box on the settings for "download messages from the server", whereupon they would reside on my local HD. That is what I want to do, I don't need to access them remotely once I've viewed them from my home office. Once they're downloaded I don't care what the server keeps, since I already have my copy. However, I do not see any such setting in the current version. Is there is such a thing, or can I find and download an older copy that does have it? And if not, any other program that you'd recommend that would allow this?
creator: service195

content: your antivirus is the security risk, it is using self signed encryption certificates. Either add 5them of disable your antivirus from scanning mail.
